d: Index the script is located in the motion.mtable file
It's an integer value obtained from calculating the CRC32 checksum on the animation name in lower case
Animation command, script file where hitboxes, sound effects, visual effects and several events are done
First Actionable Frame, frame when the animation can be cancelled with another action. In case there isn't a FAF or is equal to 0 then it will be on animation end
Frame Speed Modifier, it's a multiplier used on frame speed used to slow down or speed up animations
Hitbox identifier, hitbox priority is defined by this value with 0 being the highest priority
Group hitbox is defined into, hitboxes with different part values are considered separate and can hit a single opponent even if another hitbox has landed and hasn't been removed
Base KnockBack, minimum amount of knockback done regardless of damage and percent

Weight-Based KnockBack, if it's not 0 the knockback formula uses this value as opponent's percent and ignores move damage, these moves will deal the same knockback regardless of their damage and percentage the opponent has but still varies by opponent's weight
KnockBack Growth, in the knockback formula describes how much damage and percent scales
Sound Effect, represents the ID of the sound file to use when hitbox connects

Value where each bit enables it to hit certain hurtboxes like characters, stage elements, items and enemies
Spreadsheet with bit values
If it's not 0 it's the amount of frames a hitbox can hit again an opponent
Flag used for hitboxes that can hit user and teammates even with friendly fire enabled
Flag used on hitboxes to not make characters get damage animations nor hitstun but will still receive launch speed, also known as windboxes
Flag that makes hitlag = 0 regardless of damage and hitlag multipliers when enabled
Stretch coordinate for extended hitboxes
Hitbox property that ignores opponent's weight on KB calculation, when enabled every character hit with this hitbox will have their weight set to 100

Hitbox property that ignores opponent's gravity and fall speed for a certain amount of frames declared on animcmd, when enabled characters hit with this hitbox will have their gravity changed to 0.087 and fall speed to 1.5, after the set amount of frames passed it will revert to it's original values
Special bubble that interacts with collisions, characters and/or hitboxes

Variable conditions made on animcmd for hitbox, their meaning varies depending on the variable and character, for example Robin moves that use variable 0x2000007A bit flag enabled are moves that use the Levin Sword
